DataElement.preferredName: Neurology Cildren's Global Assessment Scale Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A branch of medicine concerned with the development, anatomy, function, and dysfunction of the nervous system._A clinician-assessed rating of psychological and social functioning in children ages six to seventeen that was developed by Shaffer et al. in 1983. The numerical scale, which is an adaptation of the adult Global Assessment Scale (GAS) developed by Endicott et al in 1976, is scored from 0 to 100 based on behaviors and life situations that are applicable to children._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A branch of medicine concerned with the development, anatomy, function, and dysfunction of the nervous system._A clinician-assessed rating of psychological and social functioning in children ages six to seventeen that was developed by Shaffer et al. in 1983. The numerical scale, which is an adaptation of the adult Global Assessment Scale (GAS) developed by Endicott et al in 1976, is scored from 0 to 100 based on behaviors and life situations that are applicable to children.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the branch of medical science that deals with the study of structure, function, and diseases of the nervous system; for thorough searching also see NEUROSCIENCE, MENTAL DISORDER, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER DIAGNOSIS, MENTAL DISORDER DIAGNOSIS, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER CHEMOTHERAPY, COMMUNICATION DISORDER, NEUROMUSCULAR DISORDER.

Concepts.definition: A branch of medicine concerned with the development, anatomy, function, and dysfunction of the nervous system.

Property.preferredDefinition: A clinician-assessed rating of psychological and social functioning in children ages six to seventeen that was developed by Shaffer et al. in 1983. The numerical scale, which is an adaptation of the adult Global Assessment Scale (GAS) developed by Endicott et al in 1976, is scored from 0 to 100 based on behaviors and life situations that are applicable to children.

Concepts.definition: A clinician-assessed rating of psychological and social functioning in children ages six to seventeen that was developed by Shaffer et al. in 1983. The numerical scale, which is an adaptation of the adult Global Assessment Scale (GAS) developed by Endicott et al in 1976, is scored from 0 to 100 based on behaviors and life situations that are applicable to children.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
